Sequence Information.Peptide Name: Calcitermin analog H13A (Ala-rich; Synthetic AMPs20, UCLL1; metallo-AMPs, BBII)

Literature.Author: Bellotti D, Toniolo M, Dudek D, Mikolajczyk A, Guerrini R, Matera-Witkiewicz A, Remelli M, Rowinska-Zyrek M. 2019
Literature.Title: Bioinorganic chemistry of calcitermin - the picklock of its antimicrobial activity.

Sequence Information.Comments: Sequence analysis: APD analysis reveals this sequence is most similar (93.33%) toHuman CalciterminA:33%; H=K: 13%.Activity: At pH 7.4, it was not active. At pH 5.4, active against E. faecalis 29212 (MIC 4 ug/ml) and S. aureus 29213 (MIC 0.25 ug/ml). The activity was enhanced in the presence of Zn2+ (MIC 0.5 ug/ml). Inactive: E. coli 25922 (MIC > 128 ug/ml), K.pneumoniae 13883 (MIC >128 ug/ml), and P.aeruginosa 15442 (MIC>128 ug/ml).SAR: H13 is important for antifungal activity.Structure: CD spectroscopy measurements show an alpha-helical secondary structure in 10 mM SDS. The peptide is able to bind Zn2+ and Cu2+ ions based on potentiometric titration, mass spectrometry, UV-Vis absorption and NMR studies.Deposited by Denise Bellotti 3/2023.
